triples.name: Intention
triples.relevance: The paper builds on the logic of intentions framework, using intention-expressions as the foundation for analyzing moral ought.

triples.name: Normative ethics
triples.relevance: The moral ought is a core normative ethical concept central to the paper's philosophical analysis.

triples.name: Collective intentionality
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel account of we-intentions as a type of collective intentionality with special intersubjective properties.

triples.name: Intersubjectivity
triples.relevance: The paper argues that intersubjectivity is a critical missing element in analyzing the moral ought through intention-expressions.

triples.name: Egocentrism
triples.relevance: The paper contrasts ordinary egocentric intentions with we-intentions to explain why intentions alone cannot ground moral ought.

triples.name: Communitarianism
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel account of moral community based on shared we-intentions that define membership in the moral community.

triples.name: Rationality
triples.relevance: Rationality is foundational to the paper's account of moral community, which consists of rational beings sharing intrinsically reasonable intentions.

triples.name: Utilitarianism
triples.relevance: The paper references happiness maximization as a principle in the shared we-intention that constitutes membership in the moral community.
